author: ArabiaWeather طقس العرب
title: A severe cold wave affects the eastern Mediterranean, and temperatures are below zero degrees Celsius in large areas (details)
text:
Arab Weather - The latest simulation of atmospheric maps shows that a very cold and Siberian air mass will rush towards the eastern Mediterranean countries in the coming days, accompanied by high surface air pressure values scientifically called the Siberian high, which brings with it very cold and dry winds and very low temperatures at night.
God willing, the Siberian cold wave is expected to affect vast areas of the countries of the eastern Mediterranean basin, including the Levant, Iraq, and the north of the Arabian Peninsula, specifically Saudi Arabia and Kuwait, reaching Qatar and Bahrain, and will be accompanied by significant changes in the weather and temperatures. The following are the effects of the cold wave in detail:
The Levant: The cold wave will start to affect from Saturday and will increase on Sunday, when temperatures will noticeably drop and become several degrees Celsius lower than their average for this time of year. The weather will be very cold and inspired by winter, in contrast to the weather that prevailed last week, while it will turn very cold at night, with temperatures dropping below zero degrees Celsius in large areas, especially the Levant desert.
Iraq: Starting Saturday, Iraq will be affected by a severe Siberian cold wave resulting from the expansion of the so-called Siberian high, where temperatures will drop sharply, especially during the night hours, becoming below zero degrees Celsius in vast areas of Iraq at night and in the early morning, and the atmosphere will be inspired by the depths of winter.
Saudi Arabia: The Kingdom is affected by a very cold and Siberian wave accompanied by a surface high pressure system called the Siberian High Pressure System, starting from the north of the Kingdom on Saturday, where temperatures will drop sharply and very cold weather will prevail in those areas. The effects of the cold wave will extend to the capital, Riyadh, and the center of the Kingdom on Saturday/Sunday night and Sunday.
Kuwait: The beginnings of the cold wave will begin on Saturday in the form of a drop in temperatures and the activity of northwesterly winds, which will be laden with quantities of dust. The effect of the cold winds towards the country will deepen on Sunday and Monday, when temperatures will drop noticeably and tangibly to approach zero degrees Celsius at night in the west of the country, and the weather will turn very cold.
Qatar and Bahrain: The effects of the cold wave are expected to extend less strongly towards Qatar and Bahrain, and thus temperatures will drop significantly. The cold and dry northwesterly winds will become active on Monday, and the weather will become cold during the night hours.
According to the computer simulation that shows the temperature path, it indicates the possibility of recording temperatures close to zero degrees Celsius in 4 capitals, namely the capital Baghdad, Damascus, Amman and northern Riyadh, while temperatures in the plains and desert areas in the Levant, Iraq, northern Saudi Arabia and the high mountain peaks drop to below zero degrees Celsius by 2 to 4 degrees Celsius.
In light of the severe cold wave that will affect the region, we recommend heating plants and livestock to avoid damage caused by the severe cold. It is preferable to cover sensitive plants using protective covers or heavy fabrics, while ensuring that a source of heating is provided for livestock in closed places or barns.
And God knows best.

author: JT
title: Army airdrops humanitarian aid into north Gaza | Jordan Times
text: AMMAN — In implementation of Royal directives, the Jordan Armed Forces - Arab Army (JAF) said on Thursday that military aircrafts conducted two relief aid air-drops into north Gaza. A JAF source said that the operation was carried out jointly with Bahrain and Oman aimed to deliver relief aid to Gazans affected by the ongoing Israeli war on the besieged strip. JAF reiterated commitment to continue sending aid through an air bridge, including aid flights departing from Marka Airport and landing at Egypt’s El-Arish International Airport. Secretary General of the Arab League Ahmed Aboul Gheit on Thursday hailed the joint airdrops of aid over Gaza by JAF, Egypt, UAE and Qatar, describing them as a significant breakthrough in alleviating the plight of Gazans. He also urged the Arab nations to sustain these operations as a countermeasure to the occupation’s policy of starvation and blockade. He also stressed that these efforts are directed towards mitigating the humanitarian crisis in the Gaza Strip, according to the Jordan News Agency, Petra. With the two operations on Thursday, Jordan has so far carried out 19 air-drops of aid into war-torn Gaza since the outbreak of the Israeli war on Gaza on October 7. The French, British, Dutch, Egyptian, Emirati, Omani, Bahraini and Qatari armies have participated in these operations. author: SBT
title: Governo faz alerta à região Sudeste sobre fortes chuvas dos próximos dias - SBT News
text: Governo faz alerta à região Sudeste sobre fortes chuvas dos próximos dias Rio de Janeiro será o estado mais castigado; há riscos de deslizamentos de terra, inundações e enchentes O Ministério da Integração e do Desenvolvimento Regional (MIDR) promoveu uma live nesta quinta-feira (21) para informar à população sobre potenciais riscos para moradores da região Sudeste a partir desta sexta (21), por conta das [fortes chuvas](https://sbtnews.sbt.com.br/noticia/brasil/rio-de-janeiro-tem-previsao-de-chuva-extrema-a-partir-de-sexta-feira) que atingirão, principalmente o litoral norte de São Paulo e o estado do Rio de Janeiro. [+Leia mais sobre Brasil no SBT News](https://sbtnews.sbt.com.br/noticias/brasil) Participaram da transmissão representantes do Centro Nacional de Gerenciamento de Riscos e Desastres (CENAD) do MIDR, do Instituto Nacional de Meterologia (Inmet), do Centro Nacional de Monitoramento e Alertas de Desastre Naturais (Cemaden) e do Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas Espaciais (Inpe). Segundo Márcia Seabra, coordenadora-geral de meteorologia aplicada, desenvolvimento e pesquisa do INMET, essa instabilidade meteorológica é causada por uma frente fria que vem do Sul, causando já ventos superiores a 140 km/h em diversas cidades da região. Como consequência, já poderá haver registros, na madrugada desta quinta para sexta, de chuva forte, granizo e rajadas de vento em regiões de São Paulo e Paraná. Os institutos informaram que as chuvas poderão ultrapassar os 200mm de chuva, principalmente no Rio de Janeiro, região que deve ser a mais castigada entre sexta e domingo. Segundo representantes do Cemaden, haverá riscos de deslizamentos de terra, inundações e enchentes nas regiões Sul-Fluminense, Paraty, Angra dos Reis, Região Metropolitana e na Região Serrana, nas cidades de Petrópolis, Teresópolis e Nova Friburgo. As Defesas Civis de São Paulo e Rio de Janeiro já estão de prontidão para acompanhar os acontecimentos. Foi recomendado à população também ficar atenta aos canais oficiais (confira abaixo) do governo para informações sobre quais são as áreas de risco, procedimentos de segurança e evacuação, caso necessário. author: Hanna Pampaloni
title: Purcellville Moves to Upgrade Water Treatment Plant | News | loudounnow.com
text: Purcellville is working to upgrade its water treatment plant along Short Hill Road and received approval from the county Planning Commission last week. The site currently houses a 1,000-gallon ground-mounted water storage tank, and equipment to treat water from the town reservoir and a groundwater well. The town is requesting a commission permit to allow a major utility, a special exception to expand the existing facility, and minor special exception to eliminate the landscape buffer requirements. The property is surrounded by nutrient bank tree plantings located in a conservation easement. IMEG Engineering Consultant Jason Alagna said the town is looking to expand the facility to help provide more water to the town’s system. The project is included in the town’s fiscal year 2025-2029 Capital Improvement Program in three phases and is expected to cost $3 million. Completion of the project estimated for late 2028. The commission voted unanimously to approve to the application during its Sept. 24 meeting.

author: redacao@gazetaesportiva.com (Redação)
title: Liverpool vira sobre Leicester e aumenta vantagem na liderança do Inglês
text:
Liverpool vira sobre Leicester e aumenta vantagem na liderança do Inglês
Nesta quinta-feira, para fechar o Boxing Day, o líder Liverpool recebeu o Leicester City, em Anfield, e venceu de virada por 3 a 1. O jogo foi válido pela 18ª rodada do Campeonato Inglês e contou com gols de Ayew, para os visitantes, e de Gakpo, Curtis Jones e Salah, a favor dos donos da casa.
Desta maneira, o Liverpool, agora com 42 pontos, viu sua vantagem na ponta do Campeonato Inglês aumentar. Isso porque, mais cedo, o Chelsea (2º com 35 unidades) foi derrotado pelo Fulham, em pleno Stamford Bridge. O Arsenal ainda entra em campo na rodada e pode assumir a vice-liderança, ao atingir 36 pontos em caso de triunfo diante do Ipswich Town.
Por sua vez, o Leicester seguiu na zona de rebaixamento e com alerta ligado. O time, atualmente na 18ª posição, tem 14 pontos, um a menos que o Wolverhampton, primeira equipe fora da degola.
Para finalizar o ano de 2024, os dois times entram em campo pela 19ª rodada do Inglês. No próximo domingo (29), o Liverpool visita o West Ham, às 14h15 (de Brasília). Já o Leicester, no mesmo dia, às 11h30, recebe o irregular Manchester City, de Pep Guardiola.
OS GOLS
O Leicester inaugurou o marcador aos 6 minutos do primeiro tempo, quando conseguiu subir ao ataque pela primeira vez. Pela esquerda, Mavididi avançou e cruzou rasteiro para Ayew, que estava dentro da grande área. Ao receber, o jogador girou para cima de Robertson e finalizou, de perna direita, no canto inferior direito de Alisson, que não alcançou.
O empate do Liverpool saiu nos acréscimos da etapa inicial, aos 46 minutos. Mac Allister passou para Cody Gakpo, que, de fora da área, finalizou de perna direita, colocado, no canto esquerdo de Stolarczyk, goleiro dos visitantes.
No início da etapa complementar, aos 3 minutos, os Reds viraram. A equipe mandante rapidamente recuperou a posse de bola dentro da área do Leicester e Salah passou para Mac Allister. O argentino, camisa 10, cruzou rasteiro e Curtis Jones, livre de marcação, completou para o fundo das redes.
Para fechar a conta, aos 37 minutos o Liverpool anotou seu terceiro gol na partida. Gakpo lançou para Salah, que avançou pela esquerda, invadiu a área e finalizou de canhota no canto inferior direito de Stolarczyk.

author: Bai Xu,Tai Sicong
title: New book recalls heroics of the "Oskar Schindler of China" | The Star
text:
By Bai Xu and Tai Sicong World Saturday, 20 Jan 2024
2:11 AM MYT Related News Technology 1d ago India's Tata Technologies to invest $1.8 billion in Telangana state Corporate News 1d ago XTS Technologies launches 11-metre-high autonomous robot, Haipick Smartphones 1d ago Samsung vies to make AI more mainstream by baking in more of the technology in its new Galaxy phones BEIJING, Jan. 19 (Xinhua) -- The launch ceremony of a book about the time John Rabe spent in China was hosted by Beijing Union University and Research Press on Friday afternoon.
John Rabe, dubbed the "Oskar Schindler of China," and dozens of other foreigners risked their lives to set up an international safety zone in Nanjing, and thereby saved the lives of more than 200,000 Chinese people between 1937 and 1938.
The book, "Rabe and China," contains the diary of John Rabe and other relevant documents and recounts the 30 years he spent in China in places including Beijing, Tianjin and Nanjing, as well as the enduring friendship between the Rabe family and China. The diary and documents were supplied by friends and relatives of Rabe who also gave their permission for it to be used in this book.
The book was written by John Rabe's grandson, German reproductive endocrinologist Thomas Rabe. "Today is a very important day for the friendship of the Rabe family and China, which has been continuing for four generations and over 115 years," Thomas Rabe said in a video address at the ceremony.
After reviewing his grandfather's experiences in China, as well as his own collaboration and friendship with Chinese medical experts, he said that the cooperation of the Rabe family over four generations with China is proof of a strong bond between the Rabe family and China, or between Germany and China in general, today and in the future.
Ding Bo, chief editor of Research Press, said the book not only records the history of the Nanjing Massacre from different perspectives, but also interprets the mental and emotional basis of John Rabe's feat back then, as well as the efforts made by his descendants to publicize his deeds and inherit his spirit.
